item.title: First post, last assignment
item.description: Connecting R and Python In this post I'll be showing how we are able to take a dataset from R and create an output in python. library(boot) head(beaver1) ## day time temp activ ## 1 346 840 36.33 0 ## 2 346 850 36.34 0 ## 3 346 900 36.35 0 ## 4 346 910 36.42 0 ## 5 346 920 36.55 0 ## 6 346 930 36.69 0 beav <- beaver1 I scrolled through the list of datasets in R looking for a fun one to use for this post, settled on this dataset because I saw a video of a beaver earlier today and he was very cute.
